meanings.definition: An enzyme that catalyzes the hydrolysis of glycosidic bonds in glycosides.
meanings.sent1: The glycosidase helped break down the sugar bonds in the food.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the glycosidase to understand how it breaks down sugars.
meanings.sent3: The glycosidase at the party was the one who could break the candy bars the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a glycosidase, breaking through all obstacles in her way.
meanings.sent5: The glycosidase enzyme worked tirelessly to break apart the sugar molecules.

meanings.definition: A protein that breaks down glycosides into simpler sugars.
meanings.sent1: The body needs glycosidase to help digest complex sugars.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how glycosidase in the body aids in sugar digestion.
meanings.sent3: The glycosidase in the bakery was known for turning cookies into sugar cubes.
meanings.sent4: His words acted like a glycosidase, simplifying the complex issue into understandable parts.
meanings.sent5: The glycosidase protein efficiently converted the glycosides into usable energy.
